segment.source: Update requirements
segment.target: Update requirements

segment.source: Update requirements
segment.target: Update requirements

segment.source: Update requirements
segment.target: Update requirements

segment.source: This section contains the requirements for any updates that will be installed on retail devices.
segment.target: This section contains the requirements for any updates that will be installed on retail devices.

segment.source: General update requirements
segment.target: General update requirements

segment.source: An OEM update package must conform to the following requirements.
segment.target: An OEM update package must conform to the following requirements.

segment.source: Preloaded apps must be updated by using the store.
segment.target: Preloaded apps must be updated by using the store.

segment.source: Update targeting information must be set in the image and the Mobile Operator ID and Device ID must be submitted by OEM partners with every update request.
segment.target: Update targeting information must be set in the image and the Mobile Operator ID and Device ID must be submitted by OEM partners with every update request.

segment.source: For more info about setting the Mobile Operator ID and Device ID when creating an update request, see New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet.
segment.target: For more info about setting the Mobile Operator ID and Device ID when creating an update request, see New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet.

segment.source: For all packages, OEMs must set the required attribute values.
segment.target: For all packages, OEMs must set the required attribute values.

segment.source: For more info, see the “Package attributes” section in Primary elements and attributes of a package project file.
segment.target: For more info, see the “Package attributes” section in Primary elements and attributes of a package project file.

segment.source: Windows Standard Package Configuration (WSPC) compliance
segment.target: Windows Standard Package Configuration (WSPC) compliance

segment.source: Retail packages must comply to the Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images.
segment.target: Retail packages must comply to the Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images.

segment.source: When you submit firmware updates, image validation is run twice:
segment.target: When you submit firmware updates, image validation is run twice:

segment.source: When you run Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet without the -NonWspcCompliant parameter, the ingestion client validates the submission.
segment.target: When you run Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet without the -NonWspcCompliant parameter, the ingestion client validates the submission.

segment.source: If the image validation fails, the image submission fails to initialize.
segment.target: If the image validation fails, the image submission fails to initialize.

segment.source: After you submit the changes, the Microsoft Update systems perform image validation a second time before processing it for code signing.
segment.target: After you submit the changes, the Microsoft Update systems perform image validation a second time before processing it for code signing.

segment.source: If the image validation fails this check, the submission will not continue to be processed for code signing.
segment.target: If the image validation fails this check, the submission will not continue to be processed for code signing.

segment.source: Firmware versioning requirements
segment.target: Firmware versioning requirements

segment.source: Versioning scheme
segment.target: Versioning scheme

segment.source: Create a versioning scheme that includes a four-part version number.
segment.target: Create a versioning scheme that includes a four-part version number.

segment.source: Packages are only updated when the new package number is greater than the old package number.
segment.target: Packages are only updated when the new package number is greater than the old package number.

segment.source: The package numbers must use a hierarchical scheme from left to right, such that version 2.0.0.0 is greater than version 1.9.9.9.
segment.target: The package numbers must use a hierarchical scheme from left to right, such that version 2.0.0.0 is greater than version 1.9.9.9.

segment.source: We recommend using the silicon vendor (SV) version number, followed by the OEM version number.
segment.target: We recommend using the silicon vendor (SV) version number, followed by the OEM version number.

segment.source: Example: SV-Major.SV-Minor.OEM-Major.OEM-Minor.
segment.target: Example: SV-Major.SV-Minor.OEM-Major.OEM-Minor.

segment.source: For consistency, consider using build environment variables such as the date when creating your versioning scheme.
segment.target: For consistency, consider using build environment variables such as the date when creating your versioning scheme.

segment.source: With each new update, create a new version number.
segment.target: With each new update, create a new version number.

segment.source: Provide both the old and new version number when submitting the update.
segment.target: Provide both the old and new version number when submitting the update.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Failure to meet this requirement leads to either ignored packages during update generation (for the packages where the version does not increase) or a complete failure in the update generation processes.
segment.target: Failure to meet this requirement leads to either ignored packages during update generation (for the packages where the version does not increase) or a complete failure in the update generation processes.

segment.source: To prevent versioning errors:
segment.target: To prevent versioning errors:

segment.source: Keep track of the version numbers in a separate spreadsheet.
segment.target: Keep track of the version numbers in a separate spreadsheet.

segment.source: Don't send two versions of the same package with the same previous version number - each update must be chained together to the previous version.
segment.target: Don't send two versions of the same package with the same previous version number - each update must be chained together to the previous version.

segment.source: The device update publishing service reserves the right to reject requests for updates (RFUs) that do not include the target version of the previous update as the source version of the new update.
segment.target: The device update publishing service reserves the right to reject requests for updates (RFUs) that do not include the target version of the previous update as the source version of the new update.

segment.source: Versioning FAQ
segment.target: Versioning FAQ

segment.source: What happens if I don't change my version number and the contents of my package changes?
segment.target: What happens if I don't change my version number and the contents of my package changes?

segment.source: The package will be considered to be the same as the existing version, and it will not be downloaded and installed when users update their device
segment.target: The package will be considered to be the same as the existing version, and it will not be downloaded and installed when users update their device

segment.source: Should I use the same version numbers across all my packages?
segment.target: Should I use the same version numbers across all my packages?

segment.source: Some versions may be different if they accurately indicate a previous package version will be used.
segment.target: Some versions may be different if they accurately indicate a previous package version will be used.

segment.source: You should be consistent with the versioning scheme that is used, for example in how versions numbers are incremented and what each element in the four part version number represents.
segment.target: You should be consistent with the versioning scheme that is used, for example in how versions numbers are incremented and what each element in the four part version number represents.

segment.source: Should all of the drivers' versions match the packages' versions for each update?
segment.target: Should all of the drivers' versions match the packages' versions for each update?

segment.source: It is recommended to have the drivers' package version numbers follow a similar versioning scheme as much as possible, but it is not a requirement that all versions of all of the packages be identical.
segment.target: It is recommended to have the drivers' package version numbers follow a similar versioning scheme as much as possible, but it is not a requirement that all versions of all of the packages be identical.

segment.source: Any package to be updated must have an incremented version number.
segment.target: Any package to be updated must have an incremented version number.

segment.source: Update partition requirements
segment.target: Update partition requirements

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: All user data and settings are preserved when updates are installed to the device.
segment.target: All user data and settings are preserved when updates are installed to the device.

segment.source: You are required to ensure that user settings are preserved when devices are updated.
segment.target: You are required to ensure that user settings are preserved when devices are updated.

segment.source: The majority of updates are made to the main OS.
segment.target: The majority of updates are made to the main OS.

segment.source: There may be a need to update other partitions in the device.
segment.target: There may be a need to update other partitions in the device.

segment.source: This section provides information about which partitions can be updated.
segment.target: This section provides information about which partitions can be updated.

segment.source: For info about the SV partitions, contact the SoC vendor.
segment.target: For info about the SV partitions, contact the SoC vendor.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Partition layout changes are not supported on the device.
segment.target: Partition layout changes are not supported on the device.

segment.source: If you submit binary partition packages that depend on a new partition layout, undefined results may occur when they are applied to the device
segment.target: If you submit binary partition packages that depend on a new partition layout, undefined results may occur when they are applied to the device

segment.source: The following partitions can be updated:
segment.target: The following partitions can be updated:

segment.source: EFIESP – Boot manager, boot configuration database, UEFI apps
segment.target: EFIESP – Boot manager, boot configuration database, UEFI apps

segment.source: UEFI
segment.target: UEFI

segment.source: SBL1, SBL2, SBL3 – Secure boot loaders
segment.target: SBL1, SBL2, SBL3 – Secure boot loaders

segment.source: RPM
segment.target: RPM

segment.source: TZ
segment.target: TZ

segment.source: PLAT – ACPI table
segment.target: PLAT – ACPI table

segment.source: WINSECAPP
segment.target: WINSECAPP

segment.source: Main OS
segment.target: Main OS

segment.source: OEMs must not update the following partitions.
segment.target: OEMs must not update the following partitions.

segment.source: DPP
segment.target: DPP

segment.source: Data – the user data partition
segment.target: Data – the user data partition

segment.source: SD Card
segment.target: SD Card

segment.source: Update OS
segment.target: Update OS

segment.source: ACPI table versioning during BSP updates
segment.target: ACPI table versioning during BSP updates

segment.source: Every time you change an ACPI table in a BSP update, you should increment the OEMRevision field in the DefinitionBlock object for the table.
segment.target: Every time you change an ACPI table in a BSP update, you should increment the OEMRevision field in the DefinitionBlock object for the table.

segment.source: Doing this helps to ensure that the OS uses the latest ACPI configuration data.
segment.target: Doing this helps to ensure that the OS uses the latest ACPI configuration data.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: New-RequestForMicrosoftUpdate cmdlet
